9enum
10{
11 Value_Null = 0,
12 Value_Integer,
13 Value_Float,
14 Value_String,
15 Value_Any,
16 Value_Code,
17 Value_Macro,
18 Value_Ident,
19 Value_CString,
20 Value_CAny,
21 Value_Word,
22 Value_Pop,
23 Value_Cond,
24};
25
26enum
27{
28 Id_Var, //1
29 Id_FloatVar,
30 Id_StringVar,
31 Id_Command,
32 Id_Alias, //5
33 Id_Local,
34 Id_Do,
35 Id_DoArgs,
36 Id_If,
37 Id_Result, //10
38 Id_Not,
39 Id_And,
40 Id_Or, //13
41};
42
43enum
44{
45 Idf_Persist = 1<<0,
46 Idf_Override = 1<<1,
47 Idf_Hex = 1<<2,
48 Idf_ReadOnly = 1<<3,
49 Idf_Overridden = 1<<4,
50 Idf_Unknown = 1<<5,
51 Idf_Arg = 1<<6,
52};
53
54struct ident;
55
56struct identval
57{
58 union
59 {
60 int i; // Id_Var, ValueInteger
61 float f; // Id_FloatVar, ValueFloat
62 char *s; // Id_StringVar, ValueString
63 const uint *code; // ValueCode
64 ident *id; // ValueIdent
65 const char *cstr; // ValueCString
66 };
67};
68
69struct tagval : identval
70{
71 int type;
72
73 void setint(int val);
74 void setfloat(float val);
75 void setnumber(double val);
76 void setstr(char *val);
77 void setnull();
78 void setcode(const uint *val);
79 void setmacro(const uint *val);
80 void setcstr(const char *val);
81 void setident(ident *val);
82
83 const char *getstr() const;
84 int getint() const;
85 float getfloat() const;
86 double getnumber() const;
87 bool getbool() const;
88 void getval(tagval &r) const;
89
90 void cleanup();
91};
92
93struct identstack
94{
95 identval val;
96 int valtype;
97 identstack *next;
98};
99
100typedef void (__cdecl *identfun)(ident *id);
101
110struct ident
111{
112 //this pointer will point to different types depending upon the type of variable
113 union identvalptr
114 {
115 void *p; // ID_*VAR
116 int *i; // Id_Var
117 float *f; // Id_FloatVar
118 char **s; // Id_StringVar
119 };
120
121 uchar type; // one of ID_* above
122 union
123 {
124 uchar valtype; // Id_Alias
125 uchar numargs; // Id_Command
126 };
127 ushort flags;
128 int index;
129 const char *name;
130 union
131 {
132 struct // Id_Var, Id_FloatVar, Id_StringVar
133 {
134 union //number var range union type
135 {
136 struct
137 {
138 int minval,
139 maxval;
140 }; // Id_Var
141 struct
142 {
143 float minvalf,
144 maxvalf;
145 }; // Id_FloatVar
146 };
147 identvalptr storage;
148 identval overrideval;
149 };
150 struct // Id_Alias
151 {
152 uint *code;
153 identval val;
154 identstack *stack;
155 };
156 struct // Id_Command
157 {
158 const char *args;
159 uint argmask;
160 };
161 };
162 identfun fun; // Id_Var, Id_FloatVar, Id_StringVar, Id_Command
163
164 ident() {}
165 // Id_Var
166 ident(int t, const char *n, int m, int x, int *s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
167 : type(t), flags(flags | (m > x ? Idf_ReadOnly : 0)), name(n), minval(m), maxval(x), fun((identfun)f)
168 { storage.i = s; }
169
170 // Id_FloatVar
171 ident(int t, const char *n, float m, float x, float *s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
172 : type(t), flags(flags | (m > x ? Idf_ReadOnly : 0)), name(n), minvalf(m), maxvalf(x), fun((identfun)f)
173 { storage.f = s; }
174
175 // Id_StringVar
176 ident(int t, const char *n, char **s, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
177 : type(t), flags(flags), name(n), fun((identfun)f)
178 { storage.s = s; }
179
180 // Id_Alias
181 ident(int t, const char *n, char *a, int flags)
182 : type(t), valtype(Value_String), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
183 { val.s = a; }
184
185 ident(int t, const char *n, int a, int flags)
186 : type(t), valtype(Value_Integer), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
187 { val.i = a; }
188
189 ident(int t, const char *n, float a, int flags)
190 : type(t), valtype(Value_Float), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
191 { val.f = a; }
192
193 ident(int t, const char *n, int flags)
194 : type(t), valtype(Value_Null), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
195 {}
196 ident(int t, const char *n, const tagval &v, int flags)
197 : type(t), valtype(v.type), flags(flags), name(n), code(nullptr), stack(nullptr)
198 { val = v; }
199
200 // Id_Command
201 ident(int t, const char *n, const char *args, uint argmask, int numargs, void *f = nullptr, int flags = 0)
202 : type(t), numargs(numargs), flags(flags), name(n), args(args), argmask(argmask), fun((identfun)f)
203 {}
204
205 void changed()
206 {
207 if(fun)
208 {
209 fun(this);
210 }
211 }
212
213 void setval(const tagval &v)
214 {
215 valtype = v.type;
216 val = v;
217 }
218
219 void setval(const identstack &v)
220 {
221 valtype = v.valtype;
222 val = v.val;
223 }
224
225 void forcenull()
226 {
227 if(valtype==Value_String)
228 {
229 delete[] val.s;
230 }
231 valtype = Value_Null;
232 }
233
234 float getfloat() const;
235 int getint() const;
236 double getnumber() const;
237 const char *getstr() const;
238 void getval(tagval &r) const;
239 void getcstr(tagval &v) const;
240 void getcval(tagval &v) const;
241};

295inline int parseint(const char *s)
296{
297 return static_cast<int>(strtoul(s, nullptr, 0));
298}

474
475// nasty macros for registering script functions, abuses globals to avoid excessive infrastructure
476
477//* note: many of the VARF comments are very repetitive, because the code itself is nearly duplicated too *//
478
479/* how command registration works:
480 * In C++, all global variables must be initiated before main() is called
481 * Each of these macro kludges (which are placed at the global scope level) initializes some kind of global variable
482 * Because the macro kludges are the definition of global variables, at program initializiation, they must be run first
483 * The values of the variables themselves don't matter because they only exist to cheat and run before main()
484 * The macro kludges themselves register commands or values within some vector<>-s which keeps track of all cmds/vars
485 */
486
487//integer var macros
488//VAR_, _VARF, VARM_ are templates for "normal" macros that do not execute an inline function
489#define VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist)
490#define VARN(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, 0)
491#define VARNP(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
492#define VARNR(name, global, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
493#define VAR(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, 0)
494#define VARP(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
495#define VARR(name, min, cur, max) VAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
496
497//variable with inline function to be executed on change (VARiable with Function = VARF)
498#define VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
499 int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
500
501#define VARFN(name, global, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, 0)
502#define VARF(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, 0)
503#define VARFP(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
504#define VARFR(name, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Override)
505#define VARFNP(name, global, min, cur, max, body) VARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
506
507//hexadecimal var macros
508#define HVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist | Idf_Hex)
509#define HVARP(name, min, cur, max) HVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
510
511//hex variable with function to be executed on change (Hexadecimal VARiable with Function = HVARF)
512//the CVAR series of macros borrows the HVARF macro as it deals with hex colors
513#define HVARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
514 int global = variable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist | Idf_Hex); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
515
516//color var macros
517#define CVAR_(name, cur, init, body, persist) bvec name = bvec::hexcolor(cur); HVARF_(name, _##name, 0, cur, 0xFFFFFF, { init; name = bvec::hexcolor(_##name); body; }, persist)
518#define CVARP(name, cur) CVAR_(name, cur, , , Idf_Persist)
519#define CVARR(name, cur) CVAR_(name, cur, , , Idf_Override)
520#define CVARFP(name, cur, body) CVAR_(name, cur, , body, Idf_Persist)
521#define CVAR0_(name, cur, body, persist) CVAR_(name, cur, { if(!_##name) _##name = cur; }, body, persist)
522#define CVAR0R(name, cur) CVAR0_(name, cur, , Idf_Override)
523#define CVAR1_(name, cur, body, persist) CVAR_(name, cur, { if(_##name <= 255) _##name |= (_##name<<8) | (_##name<<16); }, body, persist)
524#define CVAR1R(name, cur) CVAR1_(name, cur, , Idf_Override)
525#define CVAR1FR(name, cur, body) CVAR1_(name, cur, body, Idf_Override)
526
527//float var macros
528#define FVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, persist) float global = fvariable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, nullptr, persist)
529#define FVARNP(name, global, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, global, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
530#define FVAR(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, 0)
531#define FVARP(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Persist)
532#define FVARR(name, min, cur, max) FVAR_(name, name, min, cur, max, Idf_Override)
533
534//float variable with function to be executed on change (Float VARiable with Function = FVARF)
535#define FVARF_(name, global, min, cur, max, body, persist) \
536 float global = fvariable(#name, min, cur, max, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */ \
537
538#define FVARF(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, 0)
539#define FVARFP(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Persist)
540#define FVARFR(name, min, cur, max, body) FVARF_(name, name, min, cur, max, body, Idf_Override)
541
542//string var macros
543#define SVAR_(name, global, cur, persist) char *global = svariable(#name, cur, &global, nullptr, persist)
544#define SVAR(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, 0)
545#define SVARP(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, Idf_Persist)
546#define SVARR(name, cur) SVAR_(name, name, cur, Idf_Override)
547
548//string variable with function to be executed on change (Float VARiable with Function = FVARF)
549#define SVARF_(name, global, cur, body, persist) \
550 char *global = svariable(#name, cur, &global, [] (ident *) { body; }, persist); /* assign variable, needs fxn prototype declared above */
551
552#define SVARF(name, cur, body) SVARF_(name, name, cur, body, 0)
553#define SVARFR(name, cur, body) SVARF_(name, name, cur, body, Idf_Override)
554
555#endif /* COMMAND_H_ */
